Package com.fdmgroup.java.timothy_chai_project_ecommerce.app

Class Cart

java.lang.Object
com.fdmgroup.java.timothy_chai_project_ecommerce.app.Cart
@Entity public class Cart extends Object
Represents a shopping cart for the customer
Author:
- timothy.chai The Cart class holds a set of CartItem objects which refer to Product classes. The Cart class also holds the relevant methods for adding and removing CartItem objects to and from the Cart.
See Also:
  • Customer
  • CartItem
  • addToCart(CartItem)
  • removeFromCart(CartItem)

    • addToCart

      public void addToCart(CartItem item)
      Adds the input CartItem to the items set in the cart. If the cart already contains another CartItem with the same ProductID, then its quantity will be increased instead
      Parameters:
      item - Specified CartItem to add
      See Also:
      • CartItem

    • removeFromCart

      public void removeFromCart(CartItem item)
      Removes specified CartItem from cart. If the CartItem specified has a larger quantity than the quantity in the cart, the target CartItem will be removed. Otherwise, the product quantity of the CartItem will be subtracted to reflect the correct quantity
      Parameters:
      item - CartItem which specifies the product and quantity
      See Also:
      • CartItem

    • cartHasProduct

      private boolean cartHasProduct(CartItem item)
      Helper method used by addToCart and removeFromCart methods to determine if the cart has the product matching the input CartItem
      Parameters:
      item - Input CartItem to check against
      Returns:
      result Returns true if cart contains a CartItem with a matching product ID
      See Also:
      • addToCart(CartItem)
      • removeFromCart(CartItem)

    • findMatchingCartItem

      private Optional<CartItem> findMatchingCartItem(CartItem item)
      Helper method used by removeFromCart to find the CartItem with the matching product
      Parameters:
      item - Input CartItem to check against
      Returns:
      result Returns an Optional wrapping the target CartItem
      See Also:
      • removeFromCart(CartItem)
      • cartHasProduct(CartItem)
